intro: Danais dauphinensis, commonly known as the Dauphine's danai, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Danais dauphinensis is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
